item.description:
Maybe Spring is here?  It seems this March, the lion ate the lamb :).  But if the forecast holds, it's predicted to hit the 50s this weekend; great for a season warm-up on real rock!  Quincy Quarries is one of the best early season rock climbing destinations, since with open sun-exposed cliffs, it often feels 10 degrees warmer than the actual temperature.  Come get your climb on, and let's do some rope-sharing!

Details:

Who:  All levels welcome, beginner to advanced.  Event intended for climbers who are, at a minimum, solid on their top-rope belay skills, and it's recommended to confirm the competency of your belayer before getting on the wall.  We'll also be double-checking each others' anchors.

Where:  Quincy Quarries.  Let's shoot to meet up at J and K walls.  (We'll move on from there if already taken, but I'll try to get there a little early to grab some prime real estate, and feel free to join me).  Just look and ask around for the Meetup group folk.  I may be at the top of the cliff setting up anchors when you arrive, so maybe give a shout up there.  Directions are in the Boston Rocks climbing guide, http://www.bostonrocksonline.com/about.html 

What To Bring:

- Personal climbing gear: harness, climbing shoes, belay device, etc.

- Appropriate outdoor clothing and layers to handle temps in the 40-60 degree range.

- Snacks, Water, etc

- Sunscreen

- Boots/shoes to handle possible muddy ground conditions

- Rope and Top-Rope anchor setup gear (if you have it)

- Tarp or Carpet Scrap, etc, for changing shoes at cliff base (if you have it)

- Boston Rocks Guidebook (if you have it)

RSVPs and Cancellations:  Please RSVP if you're committed to coming, and update your RSVP status if you need to cancel.  Except in case of emergency, no-shows are NOT cool.  Inclement weather or lack of interest will cancel the event (when in doubt, leave a comment, or shoot the event host a message).

Get Ready to Rock Out!

Deb
item.name: Outdoor Rock Climbing @ Quincy Quarries
